verses.verse: ( Inside the Temple) וַיְבִיאֵ֖נִי <WH935> way·ḇî·’ê·nî Then [the man] brought me אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- into הַהֵיכָ֑ל <WH1964> ha·hê·ḵāl the outer sanctuary וַיָּ֣מָד <WH4058> way·yā·māḏ and measured אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הָאֵילִ֗ים <WH352> hā·’ê·lîm the side pillars שֵׁשׁ־ <WH8337> šêš- [to be] six אַמּ֨וֹת <WH520> ’am·mō·wṯ cubits רֹ֧חַב־ <WH7341> rō·ḥaḇ- wide ( 6 (long) cubits is approximately 10.5 feet or 3.2 meters; also in verses 3, 5, and 8.) מִפּ֛וֹ <WH6311> mip·pōw on each side וְשֵׁשׁ־ <WH8337> wə·šêš- ... אַמּֽוֹת־ <WH520> ’am·mō·wṯ- ... רֹ֥חַב <WH7341> rō·ḥaḇ ... מִפּ֖וֹ <WH6311> mip·pōw ... רֹ֥חַב <WH7341> rō·ḥaḇ ... הָאֹֽהֶל׃ <WH168> hā·’ō·hel .... ( One Hebrew manuscript and LXX; most Hebrew manuscripts on each side—the width of the tent)

וְרֹ֣חַב <WH7341> wə·rō·ḥaḇ The width הַפֶּתַח֮ <WH6607> hap·pe·ṯaḥ of the entrance עֶ֣שֶׂר <WH6235> ‘e·śer [was] ten אַמּוֹת֒ <WH520> ’am·mō·wṯ cubits, ( 10 (long) cubits is approximately 17.5 feet or 5.3 meters.) וְכִתְפ֣וֹת <WH3802> wə·ḵiṯ·p̄ō·wṯ and the sides הַפֶּ֔תַח <WH6607> hap·pe·ṯaḥ of the entrance חָמֵ֤שׁ <WH2568> ḥā·mêš [were] five אַמּוֹת֙ <WH520> ’am·mō·wṯ cubits ( 5 (long) cubits is approximately 8.75 feet or 2.7 meters; also in verses 9, 11, and 12.) מִפּ֔וֹ <WH6311> mip·pōw on each וְחָמֵ֥שׁ <WH2568> wə·ḥā·mêš אַמּ֖וֹת <WH520> ’am·mō·wṯ cubits, מִפּ֑וֹ <WH6311> mip·pōw side. וַיָּ֤מָד <WH4058> way·yā·māḏ He also measured אָרְכּוֹ֙ <WH753> ’ā·rə·kōw the length [of the outer sanctuary] אַרְבָּעִ֣ים <WH705> ’ar·bā·‘îm [to be] forty אַמָּ֔ה <WH520> ’am·māh cubits. ( The outer sanctuary was approximately 70 feet long and 35 feet wide (21.3 meters long and 10.7 meters wide).) וְרֹ֖חַב <WH7341> wə·rō·ḥaḇ and the width עֶשְׂרִ֥ים <WH6242> ‘eś·rîm [to be] twenty אַמָּֽה׃ <WH520> ’am·māh vvv

וּבָ֣א <WH935> ū·ḇā And he went לִפְנִ֔ימָה <WH6441> lip̄·nî·māh into [the inner sanctuary] וַיָּ֥מָד <WH4058> way·yā·māḏ and measured אֵֽיל־ <WH352> ’êl- the side pillars הַפֶּ֖תַח <WH6607> hap·pe·ṯaḥ at the entrance שְׁתַּ֣יִם <WH8147> šə·ta·yim [to be] two אַמּ֑וֹת <WH520> ’am·mō·wṯ cubits [wide]. ( 2 (long) cubits is approximately 3.5 feet or 1.1 meters.) וְהַפֶּ֙תַח֙ <WH6607> wə·hap·pe·ṯaḥ The entrance שֵׁ֣שׁ <WH8337> šêš [was] six אַמּ֔וֹת <WH520> ’am·mō·wṯ cubits [wide], וְרֹ֥חַב <WH7341> wə·rō·ḥaḇ wide. ( 7 (long) cubits is approximately 12.25 feet or 3.7 meters.) הַפֶּ֖תַח <WH6607> hap·pe·ṯaḥ [and the walls on each side] שֶׁ֥בַע <WH7651> še·ḇa‘ [were] seven אַמּֽוֹת׃ <WH520> ’am·mō·wṯ cubits

וַיָּ֨מָד <WH4058> way·yā·māḏ Then he measured אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - אָרְכּ֜וֹ <WH753> ’ā·rə·kōw long עֶשְׂרִ֣ים <WH6242> ‘eś·rîm [to be] twenty אַמָּ֗ה <WH520> ’am·māh cubits וְרֹ֛חַב <WH7341> wə·rō·ḥaḇ wide. ( The room was approximately 35 feet long and 35 feet wide (10.7 meters long and 10.7 meters wide).) עֶשְׂרִ֥ים <WH6242> ‘eś·rîm [and] twenty אַמָּ֖ה <WH520> ’am·māh cubits אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- [the room] adjacent to פְּנֵ֣י <WH6440> pə·nê ... הַֽהֵיכָ֑ל <WH1964> ha·hê·ḵāl the inner sanctuary ( Or the length of the inner sanctuary) וַיֹּ֣אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer And he said אֵלַ֔י <WH413> ’ê·lay to me, זֶ֖ה <WH2088> zeh “ This קֹ֥דֶשׁ <WH6944> qō·ḏeš is the Most Holy Place הַקֳּדָשִֽׁים׃ <WH6944> haq·qo·ḏā·šîm .... ” ( Or the Holy of Holies)

( Outside the Temple) וַיָּ֥מָד <WH4058> way·yā·māḏ Next he measured קִֽיר־ <WH7023> qîr- the wall הַבַּ֖יִת <WH1004> hab·ba·yiṯ of the temple שֵׁ֣שׁ <WH8337> šêš [to be] six אַמּ֑וֹת <WH520> ’am·mō·wṯ cubits [thick], וְרֹ֣חַב <WH7341> wə·rō·ḥaḇ and the width הַצֵּלָע֩ <WH6763> haṣ·ṣê·lā‘ side room אַרְבַּ֨ע <WH702> ’ar·ba‘ [was] four אַמּ֜וֹת <WH520> ’am·mō·wṯ cubits. ( 4 (long) cubits is approximately 7 feet or 2.1 meters.) סָבִ֧יב׀ <WH5439> sā·ḇîḇ around סָבִ֛יב <WH5439> sā·ḇîḇ ... לַבַּ֖יִת <WH1004> lab·ba·yiṯ the temple סָבִֽיב׃ <WH5439> sā·ḇîḇ of each

וְהַצְּלָעוֹת֩ <WH6763> wə·haṣ·ṣə·lā·‘ō·wṯ The side rooms צֵלָ֨ע <WH6763> ṣê·lā‘ were arranged one אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- above צֵלָ֜ע <WH6763> ṣê·lā‘ another שָׁל֧וֹשׁ <WH7969> šā·lō·wōš in three levels וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים <WH7970> ū·šə·lō·šîm of thirty rooms each. פְּעָמִ֗ים <WH6471> pə·‘ā·mîm ... וּ֠בָאוֹת <WH935> ū·ḇā·’ō·wṯ There were ledges בַּקִּ֨יר <WH7023> baq·qîr the wall אֲשֶׁר־ <WH834> ’ă·šer- - לַבַּ֧יִת <WH1004> lab·ba·yiṯ of the temple לַצְּלָע֛וֹת <WH6763> laṣ·ṣə·lā·‘ō·wṯ for the side rooms, סָבִ֥יב׀ <WH5439> sā·ḇîḇ all around סָבִ֖יב <WH5439> sā·ḇîḇ ... לִהְי֣וֹת <WH1961> lih·yō·wṯ to serve as אֲחוּזִ֑ים <WH270> ’ă·ḥū·zîm supports וְלֹֽא־ <WH3808> wə·lō- would not יִהְי֥וּ <WH1961> yih·yū be [fastened] into אֲחוּזִ֖ים <WH270> ’ă·ḥū·zîm so that the supports בְּקִ֥יר <WH7023> bə·qîr the wall הַבָּֽיִת׃ <WH1004> hab·bā·yiṯ of the temple itself.

וְֽרָחֲבָ֡ה <WH7337> wə·rā·ḥă·ḇāh widened at each successive level וְֽנָסְבָה֩ <WH5437> wə·nā·sə·ḇāh ... לְמַ֨עְלָה <WH4605> lə·ma‘·lāh ..., לְמַ֜עְלָה <WH4605> lə·ma‘·lāh ... לַצְּלָע֗וֹת <WH6763> laṣ·ṣə·lā·‘ō·wṯ The side rooms כִּ֣י <WH3588> kî ... מֽוּסַב־ <WH4141> mū·saḇ- surrounding הַ֠בַּיִת <WH1004> hab·ba·yiṯ the temple לְמַ֨עְלָה <WH4605> lə·ma‘·lāh ascended לְמַ֜עְלָה <WH4605> lə·ma‘·lāh by stages סָבִ֤יב׀ <WH5439> sā·ḇîḇ because the structure surrounding סָבִיב֙ <WH5439> sā·ḇîḇ ... לַבַּ֔יִת <WH1004> lab·ba·yiṯ the temple עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- corresponding to כֵּ֥ן <WH3651> kên ... רֹֽחַב־ <WH7341> rō·ḥaḇ- the narrowing of the temple wall לַבַּ֖יִת <WH1004> lab·ba·yiṯ ... לְמָ֑עְלָה <WH4605> lə·mā·‘ə·lāh as it rose upward. וְכֵ֧ן <WH3651> wə·ḵên And so הַתַּחְתּוֹנָ֛ה <WH8481> hat·taḥ·tō·w·nāh from the lowest story יַעֲלֶ֥ה <WH5927> ya·‘ă·leh a stairway went up עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- to הָעֶלְיוֹנָ֖ה <WH5945> hā·‘el·yō·w·nāh the highest, לַתִּיכוֹנָֽה׃ <WH8484> lat·tî·ḵō·w·nāh through the middle one.

וְרָאִ֧יתִי <WH7200> wə·rā·’î·ṯî I saw לַבַּ֛יִת <WH1004> lab·ba·yiṯ that the temple גֹּ֖בַהּ <WH1363> gō·ḇah had a raised base סָבִ֣יב׀ <WH5439> sā·ḇîḇ all סָבִ֑יב <WH5439> sā·ḇîḇ around [it], מְיֻסְּדוֹת <WH4145> mə·yus·sə·ḏōṯ forming the foundation הַצְּלָעוֹת֙ <WH6763> haṣ·ṣə·lā·‘ō·wṯ of the side rooms. מְל֣וֹ <WH4393> mə·lōw It was the full length of הַקָּנֶ֔ה <WH7070> haq·qā·neh a rod, שֵׁ֥שׁ <WH8337> šêš six אַמּ֖וֹת <WH520> ’am·mō·wṯ cubits. אַצִּֽילָה׃ <WH679> ’aṣ·ṣî·lāh long

רֹ֣חַב <WH7341> rō·ḥaḇ thick, הַקִּ֧יר <WH7023> haq·qîr wall אֲ‍ֽשֶׁר־ <WH834> ’ăšer- - לַצֵּלָ֛ע <WH6763> laṣ·ṣê·lā‘ of the side rooms אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- הַח֖וּץ <WH2351> ha·ḥūṣ The outer חָמֵ֣שׁ <WH2568> ḥā·mêš [was] five אַמּ֑וֹת <WH520> ’am·mō·wṯ cubits וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר <WH834> wa·’ă·šer and מֻנָּ֔ח <WH5117> mun·nāḥ the open area בֵּ֥ית <WH1004> bêṯ between צְלָע֖וֹת <WH6763> ṣə·lā·‘ō·wṯ the side rooms אֲשֶׁ֥ר <WH834> ’ă·šer - לַבָּֽיִת׃ <WH1004> lab·bā·yiṯ of the temple

וּבֵ֨ין <WH996> ū·ḇên - הַלְּשָׁכ֜וֹת <WH3957> hal·lə·šā·ḵō·wṯ and the outer chambers רֹ֣חַב <WH7341> rō·ḥaḇ wide עֶשְׂרִ֥ים <WH6242> ‘eś·rîm [was] twenty אַמָּ֛ה <WH520> ’am·māh cubits סָבִ֥יב <WH5439> sā·ḇîḇ all around לַבַּ֖יִת <WH1004> lab·ba·yiṯ the temple. סָבִ֥יב׀ <WH5439> sā·ḇîḇ ... סָבִֽיב׃ <WH5439> sā·ḇîḇ ...

וּפֶ֤תַח <WH6607> ū·p̄e·ṯaḥ entrance הַצֵּלָע֙ <WH6763> haṣ·ṣê·lā‘ The side rooms לַמֻּנָּ֔ח <WH5117> lam·mun·nāḥ opened into this area, פֶּ֤תַח <WH6607> pe·ṯaḥ ... אֶחָד֙ <WH259> ’e·ḥāḏ with one דֶּ֣רֶךְ <WH1870> de·reḵ on הַצָּפ֔וֹן <WH6828> haṣ·ṣā·p̄ō·wn the north וּפֶ֥תַח <WH6607> ū·p̄e·ṯaḥ ... אֶחָ֖ד <WH259> ’e·ḥāḏ and another לַדָּר֑וֹם <WH1864> lad·dā·rō·wm on the south. וְרֹ֙חַב֙ <WH7341> wə·rō·ḥaḇ wide מְק֣וֹם <WH4725> mə·qō·wm The open area הַמֻּנָּ֔ח <WH5117> ham·mun·nāḥ ... חָמֵ֥שׁ <WH2568> ḥā·mêš [was] five אַמּ֖וֹת <WH520> ’am·mō·wṯ cubits סָבִ֥יב׀ <WH5439> sā·ḇîḇ all סָבִֽיב׃ <WH5439> sā·ḇîḇ around.

וְהַבִּנְיָ֡ן <WH1146> wə·hab·bin·yān Now the building אֲשֶׁר֩ <WH834> ’ă·šer that אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- faced פְּנֵ֨י <WH6440> pə·nê ... הַגִּזְרָ֜ה <WH1508> hag·giz·rāh the temple courtyard פְּאַ֣ת <WH6285> pə·’aṯ ... דֶּֽרֶךְ־ <WH1870> de·reḵ- on הַיָּ֗ם <WH3220> hay·yām the west רֹ֚חַב <WH7341> rō·ḥaḇ wide, ( 70 (long) cubits is approximately 122.5 feet or 37.3 meters.) שִׁבְעִ֣ים <WH7657> šiḇ·‘îm [was] seventy אַמָּ֔ה <WH520> ’am·māh cubits וְקִ֧יר <WH7023> wə·qîr and the wall הַבִּנְיָ֛ן <WH1146> hab·bin·yān of the building חָֽמֵשׁ־ <WH2568> ḥā·mêš- [was] five אַמּ֥וֹת <WH520> ’am·mō·wṯ cubits רֹ֖חַב <WH7341> rō·ḥaḇ thick סָבִ֣יב׀ <WH5439> sā·ḇîḇ all סָבִ֑יב <WH5439> sā·ḇîḇ around, וְאָרְכּ֖וֹ <WH753> wə·’ā·rə·kōw with a length תִּשְׁעִ֥ים <WH8673> tiš·‘îm of ninety אַמָּֽה׃ <WH520> ’am·māh cubits. ( 90 (long) cubits is approximately 157.5 feet or 48 meters.)

וּמָדַ֣ד <WH4058> ū·mā·ḏaḏ Then he measured אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הַבַּ֔יִת <WH1004> hab·ba·yiṯ the temple אֹ֖רֶךְ <WH753> ’ō·reḵ long, ( 100 (long) cubits is approximately 175 feet or 53.3 meters; similarly in verses 14 and 15.) מֵאָ֣ה <WH3967> mê·’āh [to be] a hundred אַמָּ֑ה <WH520> ’am·māh cubits וְהַגִּזְרָ֤ה <WH1508> wə·hag·giz·rāh and the temple courtyard וְהַבִּנְיָה֙ <WH1140> wə·hab·bin·yāh and the building וְקִ֣ירוֹתֶ֔יהָ <WH7023> wə·qî·rō·w·ṯe·hā with its walls אֹ֖רֶךְ <WH753> ’ō·reḵ long. מֵאָ֥ה <WH3967> mê·’āh [were] also a hundred אַמָּֽה׃ <WH520> ’am·māh cubits
